meeting_request.purpose: Help deciding between graduate school and a different career path
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Kevin, a third-year majoring in East Asian Languages and Literatures. I’ve taken a lot of interesting courses, but I’m not sure if graduate school is the right fit for what I’ve been studying. My major is Chinese, and I’ve taken classes in Chinese literature, translation, and film, as well as history and philosophy of East Asian civilizations. I’ve also taken courses on globalization, migration, and cultural exchange, which have really engaged me. I’m considering applying to graduate programs in East Asian studies or international affairs, but I’m not sure if I should stay in the Asian studies track or switch to something else. I’m not sure what career path I’m interested in, but I’m interested in something related to language, education, or international relations. I’m worried about transferring if I don’t figure out what I want to do soon.
